content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────────
### Stone Furnace Facility at (0.0, 0.0)
Consists of:
– Stone Furnace at (0.0, 0.0) (replaced in step 1806 and updated in step 1808; used to process copper ore)
– Iron Chest at (1.5, 0.5)
Use-case: Primary smelting station for converting ores into metal plates; recently utilized for producing copper plates.

### Iron Ore Mining Setup at (–16.0, –51.0)
Consists of:
– Burner Mining Drill at (–16.0, –51.0)
– Burner Inserter at (–14.5, –49.5)
– Iron Chest at (–13.5, –49.5)
– Burner Inserter at (–14.5, –47.5)
– Fast Inserter at (–12.5, –49.5)
– Fast Inserter at (–13.5, –45.5)
Use-case: Extraction and initial transport of iron ore for further processing.

### Copper Furnace at (–27.0, –60.0)
Consists of:
– Furnace at (–27.0, –60.0)
Use-case: Processes copper ore into copper plates for advanced manufacturing.

### Lab Power Integration System at (0.5, 2.5)
Consists of:
– Lab at (0.5, 2.5)
– Offshore Pump at (–7.5, 25.5)
– Offshore Pump at (–9.5, 24.5)
– Boiler at (–4.0, 20.5) with orientation RIGHT
– Fallback Boiler at (–2.0, 26.5) placed via fallback nearest_buildable method
– New Boiler at (–13.5, 22.0) placed via adjusted buildable center attempts
– Steam Engine at (11.5, 27.5) (currently producing no power)
Use-case: Supports laboratory operations with interconnected power and fluid systems.

### Copper Cable Factory at (2.5, 6.5)
Consists of:
– Repositioned Assembling Machine at (2.5, 6.5) configured for the Copper Cable recipe (status: NO_POWER)
– Small Electric Pole at (4.5, 6.5)
– Stone Furnace at (7.0, 11.0) for smelting Copper Ore into Copper Plates
– Additional Small Electric Pole at (2.5, 3.5) and another at (2.5, 8.5)
– Intermediate Small Electric Pole at (8.5, 18.5) bridging connections
– Fallback Small Electric Pole at (0.5, 6.5) adjacent to the assembling machine
– Steam Engine at (11.5, 27.5) via multiple connection attempts
Use-case: Produces Copper Cables from smelted copper plates; persistent power and connectivity challenges remain.

### Fluid Pipelines (Multiple Pipe Groups)
Consists of:
– Multiple PipeGroups spanning positions such as (–10.5, 22.5) to (–9.5, 23.5), (8.5, 5.5), (10.5, 4.5), (–9.5, 24.5), (2.5, 9.5), (10.5, 9.5), (1.5, 11.5), (–1.5, 17.5), (0.5, 17.5), (6.5, 16.5), (–1.5, 21.5) and (4.5, 25.5)
– Note: Recent adjustments attempted to connect an Offshore Pump directly to a Boiler, though connectivity issues persist.
Use-case: Transports fluids among production components; unresolved connection issues impede full water and steam flow.

### Integrated Components
Consists of:
– BeltGroup connecting inserter and belt outputs
– Electricity network via multiple ElectricityGroups with poles at positions such as [ (–10.5, –49.5), (–12.5, –48.5), (–12.5, –50.5) ], near (3.5, 0.5), [ (6.5, 3.5), (5.5, 8.5) ] and [ (2.5, 30.5), (7.5, 26.5) ]
Use-case: Provides overall material handling and sustains factory operations through an extensive power network.

### Iron Ore Smelting Facility at (5.0, 5.0)
Consists of:
– Iron Furnace at (5.0, 5.0) (placed in step 1812 and utilized in subsequent steps for smelting iron ore into iron plates)
Use-case: Dedicated facility for converting iron ore into iron plates to fulfill sub-ingredient requirements in Automation Science Pack crafting.

ERROR TIPS
────────────────────────
• Direct Pipe Connection Issues  
 – Verify alignment and unobstructed access of fluid connection points between Offshore Pumps and Boilers; adjust placement offsets as needed.

• Entity Placement Distance Violations  
 – Move within valid build range for target placements and confirm coordinate proximity prior to placement attempts.

• Entity Placement Collision and Overlap  
 – Inspect target tiles to ensure they are free of obstructions or terrain irregularities (e.g., water, unplaceable zones) before placing entities.

• Missing Inventory for Placement  
 – Confirm required entities are present in the inventory before attempting placement, as seen with the stone-furnace availability error.

• Undefined Variable Usage Post-Placement Failure  
 – Validate that an entity placement succeeds and properly assign it to a variable before referencing its properties to avoid NameErrors.

• Buildable Area Search Errors  
 – Access Position object properties directly rather than invoking the object as a function to prevent TypeErrors.

• Entity Retrieval Type Mismatch  
 – Ensure that retrieval functions (e.g., get_entity) return a singular entity rather than a list; adjust handling logic to match the expected data type.

• Fallback Placement and Pipe Connection  
 – When using fallback or nearest_buildable methods, verify that the chosen location facilitates the required connectivity.

• Boiler Crafting Resource Shortage  
 – Confirm that all necessary raw materials are available prior to initiating boiler production to prevent crafting interruptions.

• Repositioning and Buildable Area Failures  
 – Recalculate candidate placements if initial buildable area selections are obstructed by water or terrain irregularities.

• Manual Placement Candidate Failures  
 – Survey and clear candidate locations thoroughly before reattempting manual placements.

• Technology and Crafting Prerequisite Errors  
 – Complete all required research and verify production dependencies prior to engaging in advanced crafting tasks.

• Inventory Capacity and Resource Shortages  
 – Monitor inventory capacity and resource counts (e.g., coal, iron-ore, iron-plate) closely before performing insertions or crafting to prevent operational blockages.

• Automation Science Pack Crafting Sub-Ingredient Shortages  
 – Validate that sufficient intermediate products (e.g., iron-gear-wheels) are produced by maintaining adequate smelting outputs; continuously monitor and adjust resource production to meet recipe requirements.

NAMESPACE
────────────────────────
• def distance(pos1: Position, pos2: Position) -> float  
 – Computes the Euclidean distance between two positions.  
  • Success: Returns the computed distance when dependencies (e.g., math module) are properly imported.  
  • Failure: Raises NameError if required modules are missing.

• def construct_pipe_chain(source: Position, target: Position, threshold: float, max_chain_segments: int) -> bool  
 – Attempts to build a pipe chain between the source and target using a nearest-buildable strategy.  
  • Success: Returns True upon establishing a valid connection.  
  • Failure: Returns False if construction fails due to obstructions or insufficient buildable areas.

• def pickup_entity(entity: Entity, target_position: Optional[Position] = None) -> bool  
 – Attempts to pick up a given entity from the map for replacement or relocation.  
  • Success: Returns True when the entity is successfully picked up (ensuring target_position is None).  
  • Failure: Raises ValueError if a non-None target_position is provided.

Important Variables:
 – final_inventory: Dict[str, int] – Represents the current state of the agent’s inventory.
